messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: great collection of miniature kabuto
messages.msgSnippet: Ohayo, I went to take a look at the web site also. Wow  those are really nice. They would look great on my self here at home, among my smaller pices. I too
messages.messageBody:
Ohayo,
I went to take a look at the web site also. Wow those are really nice. They would look great on my self here at home, among my smaller pices. I too would like to buy some if possible. I will pay what they cost and the shipping upfront(via money order), and pay you something for your time and effort. If this can be done please contact me. I would probley buy 10 of them at a time, (don't care if I get doubles) That way it would be cheaper on the shipping and your time. Can we do this?? Thank you
Nagamori
sinseism wrote:Hello JJ

Those little kabuto are higly detailed.The quality is beyond that of
prize because they are made by Kaiyodo,known as one of the Japanese
greatest model makers.
One problem is that we can't tell which kabuto is included until we
open the box.So It is a little hard to get a whole series even for
me.I have already doubled some kabuto.It costs $2.5 or so each,but I
will have to spend much more money to complete.

If you really want them,I might be some help.Contact me.

But I can't eat the candies up.LOL

Regards

Shinsei





--- In samuraihistory@y..., "JJ" <DarkJJ@w...> wrote:
> Konnichiwa,
>
> I know this may be an outlandish request, but I was wondering
if anyone who has access to buying those mini kabuto would be willing
to buy the whole series for me, and I would pay them back in full. I
do not live in Japan, unfortunately, and I have fallen in love with
those kabuto. If anyone would be willing to help me out, I would
appreciate it very much and be forever in your debt. Thank you for
your time.
>
>

messages.subject: Re: great collection of miniature kabuto
messages.msgSnippet: Hello JJ Those little kabuto are higly detailed.The quality is beyond that of prize because they are made by Kaiyodo,known as one of the Japanese greatest
messages.messageBody:
Hello JJ

Those little kabuto are higly detailed.The quality is beyond that of
prize because they are made by Kaiyodo,known as one of the Japanese
greatest model makers.
One problem is that we can't tell which kabuto is included until we
open the box.So It is a little hard to get a whole series even for
me.I have already doubled some kabuto.It costs $2.5 or so each,but I
will have to spend much more money to complete.

If you really want them,I might be some help.Contact me.

But I can't eat the candies up.LOL

Regards

Shinsei

do not live in Japan, unfortunately, and I have fallen in love with
those kabuto. If anyone would be willing to help me out, I would
appreciate it very much and be forever in your debt. Thank you for
your time.
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] great collection of miniature kabuto
messages.msgSnippet: If you buy them for me then of course you could have the candy. How much money would it come out to for all 13 of the kabuto? I am kinda tight on money right
messages.messageBody:
If you buy them for me then of course you could have the candy. How much money would it come out to for all 13 of the kabuto? I am kinda tight on money right now, but I really want them.

Compassion go with you,

~Sasaki Kojiro~
----- Original Message -----
From: Tom Helm
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 02, 2002 10:43 PM
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] great collection of miniature kabuto




JJ wrote:

> Konnichiwa,
>
> I know this may be an outlandish request, but I was wondering if anyone who has access to buying those mini kabuto would be willing to buy the whole series for me,

Do I get to eat the candy?

Tom

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] great collection of miniature kabuto
messages.msgSnippet: Konnichiwa, I know this may be an outlandish request, but I was wondering if anyone who has access to buying those mini kabuto would be willing to buy the
messages.messageBody:
Konnichiwa,

I know this may be an outlandish request, but I was wondering if anyone who has access to buying those mini kabuto would be willing to buy the whole series for me, and I would pay them back in full. I do not live in Japan, unfortunately, and I have fallen in love with those kabuto. If anyone would be willing to help me out, I would appreciate it very much and be forever in your debt. Thank you for your time.

Compassion go with you,

~Sasaki Kojiro~
----- Original Message -----
From: sinseism
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 01, 2002 1:31 PM
Subject: [samuraihistory] great collection of miniature kabuto


Hello group.
I found a good collectible series of miniature Kabuto(Samurai helmet)
at a supermaket today.It is called "Gekisen"series and sold as a
candy with a prize.It costs 300yen.very reasonable.I got one and was
surprised at its high quality.It has 13 versions including Kato
kiyomasa's model and Kuroda Nagamasa's.Unfortunately it seems only
available in Japan currently.

This page introduces the series.
http://www1.neweb.ne.jp/wb/ks-shop/ksshop_126.htm

Shinsei
